content:
#22964 basically looks good to me, I have only one question: the PR adds several permutations of essentially the same lemma: one version is genuinely useful (and the reason for the PR); the others follow by a mere rw [inter_comm]. What's mathlib policy here, do we keep both versions?

In the particular setting of the lemma, there is a somewhat canonical* statement (which puts inl before inr, as opposed to the other way round), so one could argue for keeping only one of these.

\* at least in cultures used to reading/writing left-to-right... given that we're communicating in English, perhaps this assumption is fine?
I just addressed all review comments so far.
Adding a new simp lemma Disjoint.inter_eq_empty caused two spurious simpNF linter errors (and one lemma becomes provable by simp): I'd welcome another pair of eyes on this.
